alert.note: Alert for Fremont; Mills (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 14 at 9:14PM CDT until April 14 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Fremont County in southwestern Iowa... Southern Mills County in southwestern Iowa... Eastern Otoe County in southeastern Nebraska... Southeastern Cass County in southeastern Nebraska... * Until 1015 PM CDT. * At 913 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles east of Weeping Water to 3 miles northwest of Nebraska City to near Julian, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. At 9 PM, a 60 mph wind gust was reported near Talmage. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Murray and Beaver Lake around 925 PM CDT. Hamburg and Sidney around 930 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Tabor, Riverton, Farragut, Randolph, Malvern, Shenandoah and Hastings. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 1 and 32. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
